snippet: The 22-year-old man was the first to face criminal charges over conduct intended to corrupt the outcome of bets on matches at the Australian Open.
abstract: Australian officials drop a charge against Daniel Thomas Dobson of Great Britain, who had been accused of illegally relaying information from the Australian Open for the possible benefit of bettors elsewhere.

byline.original: By MICHELLE INNIS and GERRY MULLANY

lead_paragraph: The 22-year-old man was the first to face criminal charges over conduct intended to corrupt the outcome of bets on matches at the Australian Open.

headline.main: Charges Dropped Against Briton Accused of Transmitting Tennis Scores
